Utterance: Hi Ellie, it’s great to see you again. How have you been since our last session?
Hi! I’ve been good, thank you. Just trying to keep up with everything.
That’s good to hear. Last time, we talked about your family and your aspirations. Have you given any more thought to your dream job as a child psychologist?
Yeah, I have actually. I started looking into some programs that might help me get there. It feels exciting!
That’s wonderful! What did you find that intrigued you?
Well, I found some online courses about child development and psychology. I think it could be a good start for me.
That sounds like a solid plan. How do you feel about taking those courses?
A bit nervous, honestly. I’ve been out of school for a while, so I’m worried I might struggle.
It’s completely normal to feel nervous about returning to education. What do you think might help you manage those feelings?
Maybe I could set small goals? Like, just focus on one module at a time instead of the whole course.
That’s a great strategy! Breaking it down can make it feel less overwhelming. Have you thought about how you’ll stay motivated?
I think I’ll try to remind myself why I want to do this. Helping children is really important to me.
That’s a powerful motivator. It sounds like you have a clear vision. Have you spoken to anyone about your interest in child psychology?
I mentioned it to my mom. She was really supportive and said she’d help me with anything I need.
That’s fantastic! Having support can make a big difference. How do you feel about your relationship with your mom?
We have a good relationship. I mean, we have our ups and downs, but she’s always there for me.
That’s great to hear. It’s important to have that kind of support. Is there anything specific you’d like to improve in your relationship with her?
Sometimes I feel like I don’t share enough with her. I want to be more open about my feelings and struggles.
That’s a valuable goal. What do you think might help you open up more?
Maybe just starting small, like sharing something that happened during my day or how I’m feeling that day.
That sounds like a good approach. It might help build your comfort level over time. Speaking of feelings, how have you been managing your emotions lately?
I’ve been feeling a bit anxious about everything. It’s like I have so much on my plate, and I worry about balancing it all.
It’s understandable to feel that way with so much going on. Have you tried any coping strategies to manage your anxiety?
I’ve been trying to read more and spend time outdoors, which helps. But sometimes, I just feel overwhelmed.
Spending time in nature can be very grounding. Have you considered any mindfulness practices, like meditation or breathing exercises?
I’ve heard about them but haven’t really tried. I guess I’m a bit skeptical.
That’s okay! It’s normal to feel skeptical about new practices. Would you be open to trying a simple breathing exercise together?
Sure, I can try that.
Great! Let’s take a deep breath in together… and out.
*breathes in and out*
How did that feel?
It felt nice. I think I could get used to that.
I’m glad to hear that. It can be a helpful tool to use when you’re feeling anxious. Do you want to set a goal to try it a few times this week?
Yeah, I can do that. Just a few minutes each day sounds manageable.
Perfect! It’s all about finding what works for you. Now, let’s talk about your sleep. You mentioned some trouble sleeping last time. How has that been?
It’s been okay. Some nights are better than others. I still have to find the right position to sleep comfortably.
Have you noticed anything that might be affecting your sleep quality?
I think my mind races sometimes. I start thinking about everything I need to do the next day.
That’s a common issue. Have you tried writing down your thoughts or to-do lists before bed?
No, I haven’t thought of that. That might help clear my mind.
It can be very effective. You could try writing down three things you need to do the next day and then set it aside.
I’ll give that a shot!
Great! I’d love to hear how that goes. Is there anything else on your mind today?
Just the usual worries about being a good mom. I want to make sure I’m doing everything right for my child.
That’s a very valid concern. Remember that no one is perfect, and it’s okay to learn as you go. Have you found any resources or support for new parents?
I’ve joined some online groups, and they can be really helpful. Hearing from others makes me feel less alone.
That’s excellent! Sharing experiences can be comforting. How do you feel about your parenting journey so far?
It’s been a mix of joy and stress. I love my baby, but I sometimes feel overwhelmed.
It’s completely normal to feel that way. Do you have any self-care practices to help you recharge?
I try to take short breaks when I can, but I forget to prioritize myself sometimes.
Self-care is essential, especially as a parent. Let’s set a goal for you to schedule some time for yourself this week. What do you think?
That sounds good! I could use that reminder to take care of myself.
Excellent! Remember, taking care of yourself helps you take care of others better.
True, I need to keep that in mind.
Well, it sounds like you have a plan moving forward. I’m looking forward to hearing about your progress in our next session.
Me too! Thank you for today.
You’re welcome! Have a wonderful week, and take care.
Bye!
